channel.title: Comments on: "Academics are resilient to changes in peer review"

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/academics-are-resilient-to-changes-in-peer-review/#comment-2784">Duane Nash</a>.
Hi Duane,
Thanks for your kind comments! Would love to hear your thoughts on Open Peer Review. If you have the time, please comment here: https://f1000research.com/articles/6-1151/v1 - I'm drafting version 2 of this right now, and incorporating all the feedback!
Jon
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Duane Nash.

Hi Duane,

Thanks for your kind comments! Would love to hear your thoughts on Open Peer Review. If you have the time, please comment here: https://f1000research.com/articles/6-1151/v1 – I’m drafting version 2 of this right now, and incorporating all the feedback!

Jon

item.title: By: Duane Nash
item.dc:creator: Duane Nash
item.description: You are doing important work Jon, keep it up. I have recently come to the same conclusions regarding transparency and open science. I have some ideas that can be used to augment the system of open science, especially regarding open peer review.
item.content:encoded: You are doing important work Jon, keep it up. I have recently come to the same conclusions regarding transparency and open science. I have some ideas that can be used to augment the system of open science, especially regarding open peer review.
